Article Title: Shubman Gill released from squad; Rishabh Pant to lead India in Guwahati Test
Article Text:
Shubman Gill

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak shares key update on Shubman Gill's fitness ahead of second Test in Guwahati

NEW DELHI: India Test captain Shubman Gill has been released from the squad ahead of the Guwahati Test and has already left for Mumbai on Friday. The youngster travelled with the side on November 19 but didn't turn up for training on November 20. It is learnt that he will be resting in Mumbai for the next two-three days before seeking specialist opinion from Dr Dinshaw Pardiwala. As of now, there is no trip planned to the BCCI Centre of Excellence (CoE) and more clarity is expected in the coming days.In Gill's absence, Pant will lead the side in the crucial second Test vs South Africa starting November 22. The team management will have to take some tough Playing XI calls and as TimesofIndia.com had reported, Sai Sudharsan and Nitish Kumar Reddy are frontrunners to be picked with Axar Patel likely to return on the bench. In the training session on eve of the match, only KL Rahul, Yashasvi Jaiswal and Sudharsan turned up as the rest took it easy.India lost the first Test at the Eden Gardens inside three days and a lot of focus has been on the playing surface since then. While Eden wasn't the ideal surface, Guwahati is expected to roll out a red soil pitch which will offer both turn and bounce. It may not be as unplayable as Eden but will keep the spinners in play.India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak spoke at length about the pitch for the opening Test and felt it wasn't something they expected."See, in the last match wicket, Gautam said that he took all the blame on himself. He said that he took the blame because he felt that he should not put the blame on the curators," Kotak said. "Now, what happened in the last match, after a day, it felt like it was crumbling. There was a little bit of soil [that came up after the ball pitched]. All of you can see that. That was not expected. Even if the spin was expected, it was after 3 days or on the third day in the evening. Sometimes, the weather, sometimes, even the curators did not want it. I am telling you the truth. No one wanted it to be like this."
Article Summary: India Test captain Shubman Gill has been released from the squad ahead of the Guwahati Test. The youngster travelled with the side on November 19 but didn't turn up for training on November 20. He will be resting in Mumbai for the next two-three days before seeking specialist opinion from Dr Dinshaw Pardiwala.

Article Title: 'Tighter jeans this time': Magnus Carlsen reignites 'fashion war' with FIDE ahead of World Rapid & Blitz 2025
Article Text:
Returning to the World Rapid & Blitz Championship in Doha, Magnus Carlsen isn't holding back – he has playfully resurrected the 'jeansgate' drama from last year in a recent social media post. With a nod to 'viral rage moments' and a commitment to tighter jeans, he teases a fun and defiant stance towards FIDE’s attire rules.

Poll Do you think FIDE's dress code policy is outdated? Yes, it needs revision. No, rules are important.

NEW DELHI: Magnus Carlsen has reignited his long-running feud with FIDE in trademark style, firing off a cheeky yet brutal jab at the chess world’s governing body soon after his participation in the World Rapid & Blitz Championship 2025 was confirmed. The Norwegian superstar, who tops the list of 360 registered players, took to social media to remind everyone — especially FIDE — that he has not forgotten “jeansgate,” the controversy that rocked last year’s championship.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW! Carlsen, disqualified in 2024 for wearing jeans in violation of the federation’s dress code, was fined $200 and asked to change. Instead, he famously walked out of the rapid event before later returning for the blitz section only after FIDE softened its stance and allowed “appropriate jeans.” The dramatic standoff divided the chess world, with critics accusing Carlsen of leveraging his influence and others defending his right to dress comfortably.On Thursday, as FIDE announced the player list for Doha 2025, Carlsen responded with a tweet dripping in sarcasm and defiance. “Nine years ago, I left the world rapid and blitz in Doha with two near misses and some viral rage moments,” he posted. “This year, I hope to improve on the former… Also, I’ll be grinding at the gym to fit into tighter jeans than last time.”The message instantly went viral, signalling that the five-time world champion is prepared to relive — and perhaps escalate — the fashion-fuelled conflict that dominated last year’s headlines.Carlsen’s participation had been uncertain due to his ongoing clash with FIDE over the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam and the fallout from his disqualification. But his tweet not only confirmed his return; it delivered another sharp poke at the federation’s authority.For context, the jeans Carlsen wore during the 2024 controversy were later auctioned for Rs 31 lakh ($36,100), turning the moment into one of the most bizarre chapters in modern chess history.With Carlsen promising “viral rage moments” once again, the Doha championship may have already found its biggest storyline before a single piece has been moved.
Article Summary: Magnus Carlsen will play in World Rapid & Blitz Championship 2025 in Doha. He was disqualified in 2024 for wearing jeans in violation of the federation’s dress code. Carlsen famously walked out of the rapid event before later returning for the blitz section.

Article Title: Gautam Gambhir under fire: 'Were we wasting time with Karun Nair or Sai Sudharsan?' - Ex-India cricketer questions
Article Text:
Kolkata: India's Sai Sudharsan with head coach Gautam Gambhir (PTI Photo/Swapan Mahapatra)

Why coach Gautam Gambhir can't continue with his IPL ways in Test cricket

India’s evolving approach to their batting order has once again raised eyebrows, with head coach Gautam Gambhir and the team management making another unexpected shuffle during the first Test against South Africa at Eden Gardens. In a move that surprised many, India fielded four frontline spinners and sent Washington Sundar in at number 3, a slot previously occupied by Sai Sudharsan in the West Indies series earlier this year. Before that, both Sudharsan and Karun Nair had been used at the same position during the tour of England.Former India batter Aakash Chopra voiced his concerns over the continuous reshuffling and questioned whether the team was lacking clarity in its long-term plans.“Washington Sundar has presented himself as a phenomenal option who can bat at the top of the order, and of course is a more than handy bowler. The bigger question that Gautam and the team management need to answer is are we going to keep changing goalposts after every series?” Chopra said during a JioStar media day interaction.Sudharsan, who made scores of 7, 87 and 39 against the West Indies, found himself out of the XI for the opening Test against South Africa. Sundar replaced him at number 3 and made 29 and 31 in the match.“You’re well within your rights to go with Washington, but if Washi is your long term choice, then were we just wasting time with Sai Sudharsan or even Karun Nair to bat at 3?” Chopra asked.He stressed that India’s top order must prioritise pure batting attributes above all else.“You would first want to prioritise the batting capabilities, not only the skill but also the temperament and the patience and the ability to bat time. That is why you look for the purest specialists who have only one job to do. Your top 4 or 5 are there just to bat and nothing else.”Chopra added that if Sundar is indeed being groomed primarily as a batter, the last several months of experimentation may have served little purpose.“If you choose Washington Sundar as a batter, fair enough, but it just feels like the last six or seven months were futile and you didn't really gain anything from it,” he said.He also questioned the messaging to Sudharsan, who performed reasonably well but still lost his place.“What message do you give to Sai Sudharsan that we gave you a chance, you scored the runs, but we had a change of heart. Transition gives you the chance to experiment, but what makes it easier is clarity and consistency,” Chopra concluded.
Article Summary: India's evolving approach to their batting order has once again raised eyebrows. Head coach Gautam Gambhir and the team management made another unexpected shuffle during the first Test against South Africa at Eden Gardens. Former India batter Aakash Chopra voiced his concerns over the continuous reshuffling.

Article Title: Rishabh Pant poised to enter exclusive MS Dhoni club, to become only second wicketkeeper to…
Article Text:
India's Rishabh Pant (AP Photo/Aijaz Rahi)

'When you don't play well, this is what happens': Gautam Gambhir reacts to 1st Test defeat, points out what India lacked

India head into the second Test against South Africa at the Barsapara Cricket Stadium in Guwahati knowing that nothing less than a win will keep the series alive. After the heavy defeat in the first Test, the pressure is immense, and much of it rests on Rishabh Pant ’s shoulders. The dynamic wicketkeeper-batter, currently one of India’s most influential Test players, is set to take on a bigger role than ever before.With Shubman Gill unlikely to feature due to the neck spasm he picked up in the opening Test, Pant will step in as captain, marking his debut as India’s Test skipper. This promotion places him alongside one of the greatest names in Indian cricketing history. Once he leads the side out in Guwahati, Pant will become only the second wicketkeeper to captain India in Test cricket, following MS Dhoni , who last led the side in his final Test in 2014. Pant will also enter the record books as India’s 38th Test captain.The match in Guwahati will also come with a unique change in timing. In most Indian venues, a traditional Test day starts at 9.30am, with lunch and tea breaks following the usual pattern. But Guwahati, sitting on the far eastern edge of the country, sees daylight arrive and disappear earlier than most parts of India. With no daylight saving system in place, the early sunset can squeeze playing hours.To accommodate local conditions, the BCCI has adjusted the schedule for this Test. Play will begin 30 minutes earlier than usual. The opening session will be followed by a shorter tea break instead of lunch, and the longer lunch interval will be pushed to early afternoon, around 1.30pm local time. The rearranged timings are aimed at maximising available daylight and ensuring a full day’s play.With history beckoning for Pant and India fighting to avoid another home setback, the second Test in Guwahati promises high stakes, new challenges and a fresh storyline.
Article Summary: Rishabh Pant will captain India in the second Test against South Africa. Shubman Gill will miss the match due to a neck spasm. Pant will become only the second wicketkeeper to captain India. The match in Guwahati will also come with a unique change in timing.

Article Title: Steve Smith’s brutal takedown of Monty Panesar's sandpaper remark: 'Anyone who thinks…'
Article Text:
Steve Smith of Australia (Photo by Paul Kane/Getty Images)

Ben Stokes press conference: On Mohammed Siraj, Chris Woakes batting with injury, 2-2 result

Panesar’s call to “make Smith feel guilty”

Steve Smith fires back

Sandpapergate: The controversy Panesar referenced

Australia’s stand-in Test captain Steve Smith delivered a scathing and unexpected response to Monty Panesar after the former England spinner urged Ben Stokes and the English media to target him over the 2018 Sandpapergate scandal during the upcoming Ashes series.Smith, who confirmed Australia’s XI for the Ashes opener in Perth, was asked about Panesar’s provocative remarks — and he did not hold back. Rather than engaging on the subject of ball-tampering, the Australian star went straight for Panesar’s credibility by revisiting his infamous 2019 appearance on the UK quiz show Celebrity Mastermind.In recent comments, Panesar had urged England to use psychological pressure against Smith.“Ben Stokes and the England team have got to make Steve Smith feel guilty and play on that,” Panesar said while referring to Sandpapergate.He added that England should sledge Smith by questioning his ethics and captaincy: “Say something like, ‘I don’t think it’s ethical that he’s the captain.’ Really get into him and make him feel guilty… Use it as a way to help England.”Panesar went further, saying the UK media should pile on as well: “If it were the opposite, the Australian media would be all over it… ‘the cheaters have arrived’, right?”Smith’s response at the press conference ahead of the Perth Test left the room stunned.“I’m going to go off topic for a second here,” he began. “Who in the room has seen Mastermind with Monty Panesar on it? Any of you?”Smith then encouraged everyone to watch Panesar’s clip, describing it as “pretty comical.”Highlighting the former spinner’s notorious mistakes on the quiz show, Smith continued:“Anyone that believes Athens is in Germany, that Oliver Twist is a season of the year, and that America is a city… those comments don’t really bother me. That’s as far as I’ll go with that one.”The swipe landed hard — a calculated dismissal of Panesar’s stance without even engaging with the actual cricketing criticism.The Sandpapergate saga dates back to 2018 when Cameron Bancroft was caught using sandpaper on the ball during a Test in South Africa. Smith admitted he was aware of the plan and received a one-year captaincy ban along with a playing suspension, while David Warner was handed an even harsher penalty, as he would never again be considered for a leadership position within the Australia team.Though the scandal remains a talking point overseas, Smith has rebuilt his career and continues to be one of Australia’s most important Test batters.
Article Summary: Steve Smith responds to Monty Panesar's comments on Sandpapergate. Former England spinner urged Ben Stokes and the English media to target Smith. Panesar said England should make Smith feel guilty over the 2018 scandal. Australia's stand-in Test captain hit back at Panesar by referencing his appearance on Celebrity Mastermind.

Article Text:

James Foster interview: ILT20 run so far, auction picks and season ahead

Top Wicket-Takers: Farooqi leads a high-quality attack

David Wiese (Gulf Giants): 5/20 vs Sharjah Warriorz (Season 1)

Naveen-ul-Haq (Sharjah Warriorz): 5/38 vs Gulf Giants (Season 1)

A season poised for more milestones

The stage is set for another thrilling chapter of franchise cricket as the International League T20 gears up for Season 4, beginning on Tuesday, December 2 - a date that coincides with UAE National Day. The six-team, 34-match tournament promises a spectacular opening and will culminate with the final on Sunday, January 4, 2026.As excitement builds, it’s the perfect time to revisit the standout bowlers and defining spells that have shaped the ILT20’s first three seasons - performances that have elevated the league into one of the most competitive and talent-rich T20 spectacles in world cricket.The ILT20’s bowling charts are headlined by Afghanistan’s rapidly rising pace star Fazalhaq Farooqi, who last season became the first player in league history to reach 50 wickets. With 50 wickets in 29 matches for MI Emirates, Farooqi’s ability to swing the new ball and strike in the death overs has made him one of the most influential bowlers in the tournament.Following him is Wanindu Hasaranga , the Sri Lankan spin ace who has been at the heart of the Desert Vipers’ bowling unit. Hasaranga has taken 39 wickets in 26 matches, operating at a superb economy rate of 6.38, the best among frontline bowlers in the league.Rounding off the top three is England’s seasoned T20 specialist Chris Jordan, who has delivered consistently for the Gulf Giants.His 35 wickets in 24 matches, combined with his composure in pressure situations, have made him a key figure in their success.While consistency has defined the top wicket-takers, individual brilliance has created unforgettable moments in the league’s history.Farooqi again leads the way with the best bowling figures in ILT20 history - a stunning 5/16 against the Dubai Capitals in Season 3. His combination of swing, pace variation, and relentless accuracy dismantled the opposition, cementing his status as one of the tournament’s premier bowlers.In Season 1, the Gulf Giants’ David Wiese produced a superb spell of 5/20 against the Sharjah Warriorz, showcasing his knack for breakthroughs at crucial junctures. That same edition saw Naveen-ul-Haq etch his name into the record books with the league’s first-ever five-wicket haul - a fiery 5/38 against the Gulf Giants.With the ILT20 entering its fourth season, the league is primed for new records, breakout stars, and fierce competition between some of the world’s best T20 bowlers.From blistering pace to crafty spin and clutch death bowling, the tournament continues to raise the bar for franchise cricket in the region.Season 4 promises more magical spells, more landmark performances - and perhaps, new names etched into the record books.
Article Summary: MI Emirates’ Fazalhaq Farooqi is the leading wicket-taker in ILT20 history. Afghanistan’s rapidly rising pace star became the first player in league history to reach 50 wickets. Sri Lankan spin ace Wanindu Hasaranga has taken 39 wickets in 26 matches, operating at a superb economy rate of 6.38, the best among frontline bowlers in the league. The stage is set for another thrilling chapter of franchise cricket as the International League T20 gears up.

Article Title: Kemar Roach returns as West Indies name squad for New Zealand Test series
Article Text:
Kemar Roach of West Indies, center, celebrates with team mates (Photo by Daniel Prentice-Gallo Images/Getty Images)

Veteran fast bowler Kemar Roach has been recalled to the West Indies Test squad for their upcoming three-match series against New Zealand in December. The 15-member squad announcement comes as Shamar Joseph and Alzarri Joseph remain out due to injuries, with 29-year-old Ojay Shields receiving his first Test call-up.Roach, whose last Test appearance was in Multan against Pakistan in January, brings crucial experience to an otherwise inexperienced pace attack. Allrounder Kavem Hodge has also made a return to the squad since his last Test in Multan.The squad has undergone intensive preparation, with several members completing a two-week high-performance training camp in the Caribbean. These players will join their teammates, who are currently in New Zealand for the ODI series, on November 20 before a two-day warm-up match against New Zealand XI in Christchurch.The series holds significance in the World Test Championship cycle, where West Indies currently occupy the bottom position among active teams after losing all five of their matches. New Zealand will be starting their WTC campaign with this series.Cricket West Indies' Director of Cricket, Miles Bascombe, stated: "New Zealand has traditionally been one of the toughest places for any touring side, which is why strong emphasis has been placed on targeted preparation.The recent high-performance camp here in Antigua was designed to replicate, as closely as possible, the conditions we expect to face, particularly the pace-friendly surfaces."Bascombe added: "That level of intentional preparation, combined with the advantage of several squad members already in New Zealand for the white-ball portion of the tour gaining valuable time to acclimate, means this group goes into this series as well-prepared as any West Indies squad to tour there in recent years."Left-arm orthodox spinner Khary Pierre has been left out of the squad. The full squad includes Roston Chase as captain, Jomel Warrican as vice-captain, along with Alick Athanaze, John Campbell, Tagenarine Chanderpaul, Justin Greaves, Kavem Hodge, Shai Hope, Tevin Imlach, Brandon King, Johann Layne, Anderson Phillip, Kemar Roach, Jayden Seales, and Ojay Shields.
Article Summary: Kemar Roach has been recalled to the West Indies Test squad for their upcoming three-match series against New Zealand in December. Shamar Joseph and Alzarri Joseph remain out due to injuries, with 29-year-old Ojay Shields receiving his first Test call-up.

Article Title: Zimbabwe crush Sri Lanka by 67 runs as Sikandar Raza, Brad Evans lead historic T20I win
Article Text:
Sri Lanka bundled out for 95 as Zimbabwe beat them by 67 runs (X-cricbuzz)

India cricketers spotted chilling Hobart ahead of T20I vs Australia

Zimbabwe achieved their largest Twenty20 victory over Sri Lanka, winning by 67 runs in Rawalpindi, Pakistan on Thursday, led by Captain Sikandar Raza 's 47 runs and Brad Evans' exceptional bowling performance of 3-9, as Sri Lanka was bowled out for 95 runs while chasing Zimbabwe's total of 162-8.Zimbabwe's innings was anchored by Brian Bennett's 49 runs and Raza's quick-fire 47 off 32 balls after being sent in to bat first. The pair formed a crucial 61-run partnership that set the foundation for Zimbabwe's competitive total."You want to be there when the chips are down and be prepared to do the dirty work for the team," Raza said. "If I'm trying, I feel my team is going to try."Zimbabwe's bowlers dominated the match with all six bowlers claiming wickets. Evans stood out with his impressive figures of 3-9, while the team managed to restrict Sri Lanka to their lowest total in the series.Sri Lanka's batting collapse began early with the dismissals of Pathum Nissanka for a duck and Kusal Perera during the powerplay, leaving them struggling at 25-2. Captain Dasun Shanaka 's 34 runs was one of only two double-digit scores in the innings."The intent was not there from the beginning," said Shanaka, who took over captaincy after Charith Asalanka's illness-related departure."We cannot accept this with the players and experience we've got."Zimbabwe's strong performance followed their spirited showing in their opening loss to Pakistan, where Bennett and Raza had also impressed with the bat.The match witnessed a spectacular catch by Shanaka to dismiss Raza at wide long-off, though Zimbabwe managed to score 46 runs in the final five overs.The tri-series continues with Sri Lanka facing Pakistan on Saturday, with Sri Lanka looking to bounce back from their recent struggles, including a 3-0 ODI series loss to Pakistan.
Article Summary: Zimbabwe achieve their largest Twenty20 victory over Sri Lanka, winning by 67 runs in Rawalpindi, Pakistan on Thursday. Captain Sikandar Raza's 47 runs and Brad Evans' exceptional bowling performance of 3-9, as Sri Lanka was bowled out for 95 runs.

Article Title: Owner of IPL franchise, which never won trophy, says 'we don't need the auction'
Article Text:
PBKS reached the 2025 IPL final after a strong run, but fell in the final to RCB. (Photo by Pankaj Nangia/Getty Images)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!

IPL 2026 retained players: Who stayed where and for how much

Poll Do you think Punjab Kings will repeat their success from last season? Yes, they will repeat their performance No, they will struggle this season

Punjab Kings co-owner Ness Wadia says the franchise is in such a stable position after the IPL 2026 retentions that the upcoming auction may hold little more than formality for them.After years of constant rebuilds, PBKS head into December’s event in Abu Dhabi with only four slots to fill and Rs 11.5 crore available, which is in stark contrast to last season, when they retained just two players and entered the auction with Rs 110.5 crore.Much of that stability has come under the captain-coach partnership of Shreyas Iyer and Ricky Ponting, who guided PBKS to their first IPL final in 11 years.The overhaul last year, including the mega auction in Jeddah, has left the side with a settled core.Speaking to PTI, Wadia said the franchise finally has the balance it long sought.“We don't even really need to go into the auction. But we will to see how to solidify what we already have, which is a very solid team,” he told PTI, while crediting the leadership group for the shift.He added that the build-up over the past year was key.“The mega auction for us in Jeddah last year was very crucial. Now that we have Ricky and Shreyas working together with all their very valuable support staff, we're very comfortable with where we are,” Wadia said.PBKS released Glenn Maxwell as expected, while Josh Inglis was let go due to his unavailability for most of the upcoming season. Praveen Dubey, Kuldeep Sen and Vishnu Vinod also exited, none of whom were part of the XI.Wadia stressed that the target remains unchanged despite last season's strong run. “The job is not done yet as the goal was always to win the IPL,” he said.Repeating last season’s performance, he said, will be the bigger test. “Season one, we've done it. We have to repeat that again and make sure that we do that consistently,” Wadia said.The PBKS co-owner also pointed to the admiration following the team earned with their aggressive cricket. “They brought a different new game and backed their instincts and it was fun to watch… They captured the minds and hearts of everyone,” he said to PTI, before adding, “Having said that, nothing succeeds like winning.”
Article Summary: Punjab Kings reached the 2025 IPL final after a strong run, but fell to RCB. Co- owner Ness Wadia says the franchise is in such a stable position after the IPL 2026 retentions that the upcoming auction may hold little more than formality for them.

Article Title: Ashes mind games! Australia Border Force tells English fans: Wait for instructions… unlike Jonny Bairstow
Article Text:
Photo/Australian Border Force

Australia’s Border Force has taken a dig at England through a post on social media on the eve of the Ashes, using the Jonny Bairstow stumping from the 2023 series to send a pointed message to English supporters arriving for the first Test in Perth.The post came just as England are set to take on Australia for the first Test in Perth, along with a public service announcement aimed at the 40,000 English fans expected to travel for the tour.The Australian Border Force posted a picture of Bairstow’s controversial stumping at Lord’s, which ignited Ashes series of 2023 in England."On the eve of the Ashes, we're back with another friendly PSA for our international travellers. To the 40,000 English cricket fans about to descend on our shores; you might be eligible to use our SmartGates. They're heaps easy but we urge you - please wait for the on-screen instructions to guide you through, before continuing to baggage claim at the other end," the post was captioned.The message, paired with the image of Bairstow walking out of his crease before the ball was dead, made the reference clear.The Bairstow dismissal remains one of the most discussed moments of the last Ashes.Chasing 371 in the second Test at Lord’s, England were 4/114 entering Day 5. Ben Duckett and Ben Stokes had added 69 runs before stumps, with Duckett reaching his half-century. He later fell for 83, bringing Bairstow to the crease.Bairstow hit two early boundaries and looked settled until his 22nd ball. Cameron Green bowled a 129km/h bouncer that stayed low. Bairstow ducked, the ball bounced twice to reach Aussie keeper Alex Carey, and the wicketkeeper immediately underarmed it back onto the stumps. Bairstow had wandered out of his crease without waiting for the ball to be declared dead, with neither umpire having called ‘over’. Carey, captain Pat Cummins and substitute Matthew Renshaw appealed, and Bairstow was given out.The first Test of the Ashes begins Friday at Perth’s Optus Stadium.
Article Summary: The Australian Border Force posted a picture of Jonny Bairstow’s controversial stumping from the 2023 Ashes series. The post came just as England are set to take on Australia for the first Test in Perth, along with a public service announcement aimed at the 40,000 English fans expected to travel for the tour. The first Test of the Ashes begins Friday at the Optus Stadium.

Article Title: 'Hopefully, we can keep him quiet': Steve Smith names biggest Ashes threat for Australia
Article Text:
Steve Smith has singled out the player his side will look to silence as the Ashes gets underway on Friday. (Photo by Paul Kane/Getty Images)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!

Poll Should Australia aim to provoke Ben Stokes during the match? Yes, it could be an advantage. No, it's too risky.

Australia’s stand-in captain Steve Smith has singled out England skipper Ben Stokes as the key figure his side must contain when the Ashes opens at Perth Stadium on Friday. With Pat Cummins ruled out through injury, Smith steps in for his 41st Test as leader and made it clear that Stokes remains England’s biggest influence across formats.Speaking on the eve of the match, Smith underlined Stokes’ impact. “He (Stokes) has done a terrific job with England over the last couple of years,” Smith said. He added that the all-rounder is not someone Australia wants to provoke, noting, “Potentially, he’s someone who you don't want to get riled up. He has had a few performances against us where he's either taken the game away from us or pulled it back (for England). ”Smith described Stokes as a constant presence in the contest: “He's a quality performer, whether it's bat, ball, or in the field. He's always in the game, giving his 110%. Hopefully, we can keep him quiet.”England arrive confident under the Stokes–Brendon McCullum pairing, whose aggressive style has defined their recent Test cricket. Smith said Australia will have to manage the tempo carefully. “I think it's just playing the tempo of the game that needs to be played at each certain time,” he explained.He added that there will be phases when England score quickly, during which Australia may need to hold back before choosing moments to counterattack.The opening Test will also mark debuts for Jake Weatherald and Brendan Doggett. Weatherald is set to open with Usman Khawaja after a strong domestic run. Smith praised the left-hander’s preparation, saying, “I watched him bat in the nets pretty closely… He took it on and got in really good positions… He has been selected for his performances in the last 18 months in particular.”Smith said Weatherald’s rise has been earned through consistency. “I'm really excited for him… he has worked hard for a long period of time, and he is going to complement Usman Khawaja pretty well up top,” he added.Australia have a strong record at the venue but were beaten there by India last summer. Smith said conditions look familiar, adding, “It looks like a good wicket… It's going to have some decent pace and bounce in it.”With large crowds expected, Smith said the atmosphere will lift the contest: “This series has been on people's radar for a long time. I think it's a nice place to start the summer.”

Article Title: FIFA World Cup 2026: How will the last six spots be decided for the showdown in June?
Article Text:
World Cup 2026 group F qualifying soccer match. (Image: AP Photo)

UEFA Playoffs to decide four European teams

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!

Intercontinental Playoffs determine final two qualifiers

Poll Which region do you think will produce the final two qualifiers? Asia (AFC) Africa (CAF) North America (CONCACAF) Oceania (OFC)

Six remaining spots for the 2026 FIFA World Cup will be determined through two playoff tournaments in March, with four teams qualifying from Europe and two from other continents. The tournaments will involve 16 nations in UEFA playoffs and six teams in FIFA's intercontinental playoffs, completing the 48-team field for the tournament hosted by the United States, Canada, and Mexico.The European playoffs will feature 12 runners-up from qualifying groups and four highest-ranked UEFA Nations League group winners who didn't finish in their qualifying group's top two. Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Czech Republic, Denmark, Italy, Kosovo, Poland, Ireland, Slovakia, Turkey, Ukraine, and Wales advanced as runners-up.Romania, Sweden, Northern Ireland, and North Macedonia qualified through the Nations League route. Teams will be drawn from four pots based on FIFA rankings, with the top eight teams seeded.The top four seeded teams - Italy, Denmark, Turkey, and Ukraine - will face Nations League qualifiers in the semifinals. Poland, Wales, Czech Republic, and Slovakia make up the remaining seeded teams.Eight semifinals will be played on March 26, with seeded teams playing at home.The winners will compete in four finals on March 31 to determine World Cup qualification.The intercontinental playoffs will involve six teams competing for two World Cup spots. Iraq (AFC), Congo (CAF), Jamaica and Suriname (CONCACAF), Bolivia (CONMEBOL), and New Caledonia (OFC) will participate in this tournament.Iraq and Congo, the highest-ranked teams, are seeded and will advance directly to the playoff finals. The remaining four teams will play semifinals, with winners advancing to face the seeded teams in the finals.The international playoffs will take place between March 23-31. The two finals winners will secure World Cup qualification.The World Cup draw will be held in Washington DC on December 5, before the playoff qualifiers are determined. The tournament will begin on June 11, with the final scheduled for July 19.The successful teams from both playoff tournaments will join 42 other nations that have already qualified for the expanded World Cup tournament in North America.
Article Summary: Six remaining spots for the 2026 FIFA World Cup will be determined through two playoff tournaments in March. The tournaments will involve 16 nations in UEFA playoffs and six teams in FIFA's intercontinental playoffs. The successful teams from both playoff tournaments will join 42 other nations that have already qualified for the expanded World Cup tournament in North America. The tournament will begin on June 11, with the final scheduled for July 19.

Article Title: 'I know he'll be smiling down': Emotional Andy Robertson remembers late teammate Diogo Jota as Scotland qualify for 2026 FIFA World Cup

Article Title: Historic! Tiny Curacao becomes smallest nation ever to qualify for FIFA World Cup; Haiti end 52-year wait
Article Text:
Curacao football team

FIFA Shuts Down Trump's 2026 World Cup 'Unsafe Cities' Threat With Bold Remark

In one of the most extraordinary nights in CONCACAF football history, the tiny Caribbean island of Curacao — home to just 156,000 people — scripted an unprecedented chapter by becoming the smallest country ever to qualify for the FIFA World Cup . Their tense 0-0 draw against Jamaica in Kingston on Tuesday was enough to secure passage to the 2026 finals in the United States, Canada and Mexico.The result capped a dramatic, nerve-wracking finale to the qualifiers, where Curacao survived relentless pressure from Jamaica — who struck the woodwork three times in the second half — and escaped a last-minute penalty scare. Salvadoran referee Ivan Barton initially pointed to the spot after Jeremy Antonisse clipped Dujuan Richards inside the box, but VAR overturned the call in a stunning twist that preserved Curacao’s historic dream.Coached by veteran Dutch tactician Dick Advocaat, who missed the clash due to a family emergency, the ‘Blue Wave’ finished atop Group B with 12 points from six matches, one clear of Jamaica. Curacao now surpass Iceland (population ~350,000 in 2018) as the smallest nation to ever reach a World Cup — a milestone made possible in the first edition featuring 48 teams.Elsewhere, the night produced more fairytale scenes. Haiti, forced to play “home” matches in Curacao due to political unrest, sealed their first World Cup appearance since 1974 after a crucial 2-0 win over Nicaragua.Goals from Louicius Don Deedson and Ruben Providence, combined with Honduras’ goalless draw against Costa Rica, lifted Haiti to the top of Group C with 11 points.Meanwhile, Panama secured the final automatic CONCACAF berth with a dominant 3-0 win over El Salvador, extinguishing Suriname’s hopes despite their qualification for the playoffs.For Curacao, the smallest of football nations, a World Cup dream once thought impossible is now gloriously real — a landmark for the island, the Caribbean, and world football itself.
Article Summary: Smallest nation to qualify for the World Cup, Curacao, beats Costa Rica 1-0. First time in history that two nations have qualified for the same tournament. The first time that two teams from the same country have done so.

Article Title: 2026 World Cup: Scotland end 26-year drought; Spain, Belgium, Switzerland and Austria seal qualification
Article Text:
Scotland's Kieran Tierney celebrates scoring his sides third goal with his teammates (Andrew Milligan/PA via AP)

Kieran Tierney and Kenny McLean scored spectacular injury-time goals to give Scotland a dramatic 4-2 victory over Denmark on Tuesday, sealing their qualification for the 2026 World Cup. Spain also confirmed their spot after a 2-2 draw with Turkey. Belgium joined them with a 7-0 demolition of Liechtenstein, while Switzerland and Austria both secured their places after picking up draws. All five nations will feature at the tournament in the United States, Canada and Mexico next year.Scotland’s late surge in Glasgow ensured Steve Clarke’s team reached the World Cup for the first time since 1998. With the match tied at 2-2 beyond the 90th minute, Denmark were on course to progress as Group C winners until Tierney curled in a superb long-range strike three minutes into stoppage time. McLean settled the contest deep into added time, lofting the ball over Kasper Schmeichel from the halfway line in the 98th minute after spotting the Danish goalkeeper far off his line.“That just sums up this squad,” captain Andy Robertson told the BBC. “Never say die. We just keep going right to the end and one of the craziest games. We put the country through it, but I’m sure it’s worth it. We’re going to the World Cup.”Scotland made the perfect start when Scott McTominay scored with an overhead kick in the third minute.Rasmus Hojlund equalised for Denmark from the penalty spot just before the hour, but the visitors were reduced to 10 men soon after when Rasmus Kristensen received a second yellow card. Hampden Park erupted again in the 78th minute as Lawrence Shankland tapped in from close range, only for Patrick Dorgu to level four minutes later. Tierney and McLean then delivered the decisive blows. Denmark now head to Thursday’s draw for the European play-offs, scheduled for March.Switzerland booked their sixth straight World Cup appearance after a 1-1 draw in Pristina against Kosovo. Needing only to avoid a heavy defeat, they stayed in control for most of the match. Ruben Vargas put them ahead early in the second half, before Florent Muslija equalised.Spain, the Euro 2024 champions, also needed to avoid a seven-goal loss in Seville against Turkey and never looked in danger. Dani Olmo opened the scoring, though Deniz Gul and Salih Ozcan found the net for Turkey to hand Spain their first goals conceded in qualifying. Mikel Oyarzabal equalised after the hour to preserve Spain’s unbeaten run. “We wanted to finish with a win and a clean sheet, so it’s bitter-sweet... but we’re happy to qualify for the World Cup,” Olmo told TVE.Austria snatched a place at their first World Cup in 28 years after a 1-1 draw with Bosnia and Herzegovina, thanks to Michael Gregoritsch’s 77th-minute equaliser. Haris Tabakovic’s early strike had threatened to upset Ralf Rangnick’s side before the leveller sent Bosnia into the play-offs. “I can’t believe it; we made it! I have been trying to reach the World Cup for 18 years. Finally now, at the end of my career, we got there. I can’t wait,” said 36-year-old Marko Arnautovic, via UEFA.com.Belgium, semi-finalists in 2018, eased into the World Cup draw with a dominant win in Liege. Jeremy Doku scored twice, Charles De Ketelaere added a brace of his own and Hans Vanaken, Brandon Mechele and Alexis Saelemaekers also found the net. Wales matched that scoreline in Group J, beating North Macedonia 7-1, with Harry Wilson recording a hat-trick from set pieces. North Macedonia will still feature in the play-offs thanks to their Nations League ranking. Romania, who defeated San Marino 7-0, will also head to the play-offs after finishing third in Group H, and Sweden secured their own spot with a 1-1 draw against Slovenia.The European play-offs will feature 16 teams and offer four additional berths for next year’s World Cup in North America.
Article Summary: Kieran Tierney and Kenny McLean scored spectacular injury-time goals to give Scotland a dramatic 4-2 victory over Denmark on Tuesday. Spain also confirmed their spot after a 2-2 draw with Turkey. Belgium joined them with a 7-0 demolition of Liechtenstein, while Switzerland and Austria both secured their places after picking up draws. All five nations will feature at the tournament in the United States, Canada and Mexico next year.

Article Title: 'He felt superior': English female football referee says coach 'manhandled' her; complaint led to job lost
Article Text:
Photo/Social media

A Women's Super League referee Lisa Benn told a London employment tribunal that she lost her international position after reporting that a referee coach pushed her during a game in March 2023. She claimed the Professional Game Match Officials Limited (PGMOL) gave her lower recommendations after she complained about coach Steve Child's conduct, BBC reported.The incident occurred at a PGMOL tournament focused on video assistant referee (VAR) training. After a delay due to an injury, Benn says Child grabbed her arm and pushed her onto the pitch to start a game.During the match, Child told a fourth official to instruct Benn to "kill the game." Benn responded by saying "don't tell me how to referee" and used an expletive towards Child."I am a trusted referee, I referee at the highest level - this was an under-19s game," Benn told the panel."He felt superior, he felt like he could come on and tell me how to referee, he manhandled me on to the field of play - he would never have done that to a male referee," she stated.When questioned if she had witnessed Child behaving similarly with other referees, Benn responded: "I have to female referees, yes.I haven't to male referees."Benn claims Child approached her after the game, grabbed her arm and said "your card has been marked.""He was so angry his eyes were bulging out of his head," she told the tribunal, as cited by BBC.PGMOL's representative Jesse Crozier suggested Child may have simply guided her to the pitch, but Benn rejected this explanation.Crozier stated: "If you had been dragged, grabbed and pushed at a training tournament with dozens and dozens of people, someone would have seen it." Benn disagreed with this assessment.A PGMOL investigation determined Child's actions did not warrant disciplinary measures. Benn claims that while PGMOL's chief refereeing officer Howard Webb and his wife Bibiana Steinhaus-Webb, then head of women's referees, assured her she would not face consequences for reporting the incident, the organization subsequently reduced their support for her.Benn states this reduced support resulted in her losing a position on FIFA's international referee list.The tribunal proceedings are ongoing.
Article Summary: Lisa Benn told a London employment tribunal that she lost her international position after reporting that a referee coach pushed her during a game in March 2023. She claimed the Professional Game Match Officials Limited (PGMOL) gave her lower recommendations after she complained about coach Steve Child's conduct. A PGMOL investigation determined Child's actions did not warrant disciplinary measures.

Article Title: Mbappe vs PSG explodes into a €700 million war: Unpaid wages, harassment claims and 'loyalty betrayal' at heart of legal showdown
Article Text:
File Pic: Kylian Mbappe (Getty Image)

Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel.

Poll Who do you think is in the right in the PSG vs Kylian Mbappe feud? Kylian Mbappe Paris Saint-Germain Both sides equally Neither side is right

The long-simmering feud between Paris Saint-Germain and Kylian Mbappe erupted into a full-blown legal and financial battle on Monday as both sides arrived at an industrial court with staggering monetary demands — together exceeding €700 million.The French superstar, who joined Real Madrid on a free transfer in the summer of 2024, claims PSG owes him more than €260 million. This includes unpaid wages, bonuses, severance, and damages, all stemming from his argument that his fixed-term contract should be reclassified as a permanent one — a technical shift that would entitle him to compensation for unfair dismissal.Mbappe had earlier demanded €55 million in unpaid wages. His new claim now encompasses much more, including allegations of moral harassment, undeclared work, and breaches of PSG's duty of good faith and workplace safety.“Kylian Mbappe is not asking for anything beyond what the law provides; he is simply seeking the enforcement of his legal rights, as any employee would,” his advisers said in a statement. The forward did not attend the hearing in person.PSG responded with an even larger counter-claim: €440 million. The club argues that Mbappe's refusal to extend his contract — while also rejecting a €300 million offer from Saudi side Al-Hilal in 2023 — cost them a massive “loss of opportunity” to secure a record transfer fee. The Ligue 1 champions also seek compensation for alleged breaches of good faith, reputational harm, and image damage.The club said it presented evidence that Mbappe acted “disloyally” by hiding his decision not to extend his contract for nearly a year — from July 2022 to June 2023 — leaving PSG powerless to negotiate a transfer.PSG further accused the striker of reneging on an August 2023 agreement involving a salary reduction should he leave on a free transfer. Mbappe's camp insists such an agreement never existed, and says PSG failed to provide proof.The forward has also accused the club of “lofting” — a French term describing the isolation of a player from the main squad. Mbappe was excluded from the preseason tour to Japan and South Korea and initially left out of Ligue 1's opening match after informing the club he would not trigger his extension clause.PSG has denied any harassment or mistreatment, insisting Mbappe featured in “more than 94%” of official matches that season under a coach who went on to win the Champions League.The court's ruling is expected next month, with both sides bracing for one of football's most financially explosive verdicts.
Article Summary: Kylian Mbappe claims PSG owes him more than €260 million. PSG responded with an even larger counter-claim: €440 million. Court's ruling is expected next month, with both sides bracing for one of football's most financially explosive verdicts.

Article Title: Germany and Netherlands storm into 2026 FIFA World Cup with goal-fests
Article Text:
With electrifying performances, Germany and the Netherlands have clinched their World Cup berths. Germany showcased sheer dominance, obliterating Slovakia 6-0, while the Netherlands made a statement with a resounding 4-0 victory over Lithuania. Their offensive firepower has set the stage for an exhilarating global tournament.

Germany and the Netherlands sealed their World Cup berths in emphatic fashion on Monday, producing goal-laden performances in their final European qualifying matches to underline their status as major contenders for next year’s global showpiece in the United States, Canada and Mexico.Julian Nagelsmann’s Germany destroyed Slovakia 6-0 in Leipzig, while Ronald Koeman’s Netherlands swept past Lithuania 4-0 in Amsterdam. Both teams needed only a draw to secure qualification but showed zero appetite for caution.“Every player played well today and worked like a dog,” Nagelsmann told German broadcaster ZDF after his side overwhelmed Group A rivals. Four-time world champions Germany, level on points with Slovakia before kick-off, seized command early. Nick Woltemade headed the opener in the 18th minute, and once Serge Gnabry doubled the lead, the hosts never looked back. Leroy Sane struck twice before half-time, with Ridle Baku and Assan Ouedraogo completing the rout after the break.“We’re relieved. It’s a great moment,” a jubilant Woltemade told ZDF. “I’m playing, I’m scoring goals and I’m hopefully playing at the World Cup.”Elsewhere in Group A, Northern Ireland beat Luxembourg 1-0 but remained third.However, their Nations League ranking guarantees them a place in March’s 16-team European play-offs.In Amsterdam, the Netherlands delivered a high-tempo masterclass that thrilled more than 50,000 fans. Lithuania were pinned deep from the start, with Tijani Reijnders finishing off a neat move initiated by Frenkie de Jong to open the scoring. A superb first-half display by goalkeeper Edvinas Gertmonas delayed the inevitable, but Cody Gakpo’s 58th-minute penalty unlocked the floodgates. Xavi Simons and Donyell Malen struck in quick succession as Koeman’s men cruised.Reijnders, who did not debut until after the 2022 Qatar World Cup, savoured the moment. “I watched it at home, on the couch, with my Oranje shirt on,” he said. “This time it’s going to be very different for me… I’m really looking forward to taking part for the first time.”In other matches, Croatia—already assured of Group L’s top spot—fought back to beat Montenegro 3-2, while the Czech Republic thrashed Gibraltar 6-0. Poland survived a scare in Malta, edging out a chaotic 3-2 encounter but finishing second in Group G behind the Dutch.
Article Summary: Germany and the Netherlands have clinched their World Cup berths. Germany thrashed Slovakia 6-0 in Leipzig, while Ronald Koeman’s Netherlands swept past Lithuania 4-0. Northern Ireland beat Luxembourg 1-0 but remained third in Group A.

Article Title: Faster US visas? President Donald Trump unveils 'FIFA Pass' to help 2026 World Cup travellers
Article Text:
President Donald Trump speaks (AP Photo/Alex Brandon)

The Trump administration has unveiled a new program called "FIFA Pass" to expedite visa interviews for international visitors attending the 2026 FIFA World Cup . This initiative will facilitate faster visa appointment scheduling for individuals who have purchased World Cup tickets through FIFA.The program aims to balance strict immigration policies while accommodating the anticipated surge of international travellers for the soccer tournament. The term "pass" in the program name represents "prioritised appointments scheduling system.""If you have a ticket for the World Cup, you can have prioritised appointments to get your visa. You said it the very first time we met, Mr. President, America welcomes the world," said FIFA President Gianni Infantino during his Oval Office meeting with Trump."I strongly encourage World Cup travellers to the U.S. to apply for their visas right away," Trump said Monday.The State Department has deployed over 400 additional consular officers globally to manage visa applications. Currently, about 80 percent of global travellers can secure a visa appointment within 60 days.The new system allows ticket holders who purchased through FIFA to access a special portal for expedited visa application processing and interview scheduling with the State Department."We're going to do the same vetting as anybody else would get. The only difference here is we're moving them up in the queue," said Secretary of State Marco Rubio The World Cup will feature 104 matches across Canada, Mexico, and the United States. Trump has prioritised the tournament's success, with Infantino making frequent White House visits ahead of the December 5 World Cup draw at the Kennedy Center.Trump discussed the possibility of relocating World Cup matches from Seattle, one of the 11 U.S. host cities, citing concerns about the election of progressive activist Katie Wilson as mayor and the city's sanctuary status for migrants."If we think there's gonna be sign of any trouble, I would ask Gianni to move that to a different city," Trump said regarding Seattle."I think safety and security is the number one priority for a successful World Cup. We can see today that people have trust in the United States," Infantino responded, highlighting strong ticket sales while avoiding direct comments about relocating host cities.
Article Summary: Trump administration unveils "FIFA Pass" to expedite visa interviews for international visitors attending the 2026 FIFA World Cup. Program aims to balance strict immigration policies while accommodating the anticipated surge of international travellers for the soccer tournament. The term "pass" in the program name represents "prioritised appointments scheduling system"

Article Title: Camp Nou breathes again as Barcelona set to walk back into their home of stories on November 22
Article Text:
Barcelona's players exercise during the team's first training session at the venue after its renovation at the Camp Nou stadium in Barcelona, Spain, Friday, Nov. 7, 2025. (AP Photo)

Spanish football club Barcelona will return to the rebuilt Camp Nou on November 22 for their La Liga match against Athletic Bilbao, the club announced on Monday. This will be their first game at the stadium in more than two years.Camp Nou was closed at the end of the 2022/23 season, and Barcelona have since played their home matches mainly at the Olympic Stadium on Montjuic.More than 20,000 people paid to watch the team practice at the Camp Nou on Nov. 7.Work began on upgrading the stadium in June 2023 to expand capacity in Europe’s largest soccer venue that previously stood at 99,000.The reconstruction project, worth 1.5 billion euros ($1.75 billion), faced delays and is reopening a year later than planned.For now, the stadium will operate with a temporary capacity of 45,401. When the top tier is finished, it will hold 105,000 spectators. As part of the reopening process, Barcelona allowed 23,000 fans to attend a training session earlier in November.The club is also waiting for UEFA approval to host Eintracht Frankfurt at Camp Nou on December 9 in the Champions League.At the start of this season, Barcelona had to play two matches at the 6,000-capacity Johan Cruyff Stadium after they did not receive the required safety permit for Camp Nou.Barcelona plan to install a roof on the new stadium in the summer of 2027, a year later than originally planned.
Article Summary: Barcelona will return to the rebuilt Camp Nou on November 22 for their La Liga match against Athletic Bilbao. This will be their first game at the stadium in more than two years. Camp Nou was closed at the end of the 2022/23 season, and Barcelona have since played their home matches mainly at the Olympic Stadium on Montjuic.

Article Title: Why Hailee Steinfeld keeps her NFL game-day appearances lowkey despite her high-profile marriage

Josh Allen and Hailee Steinfeld (Image via: Getty)

Hailee Steinfeld stays hidden in plain sight to keep the focus away from herself

Hailee builds connection behind the scenes instead of seeking on-camera moments

Hailee Steinfeld’s marriage to Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen put her directly in the NFL spotlight, yet fans rarely see her on game days. Article Title: Tyrell Shavers steals the spotlight for Buffalo Bills, outplaying Keon Coleman and catching a 44-yard touchdown from Josh Allen
Article Text:
(Image Source - Getty Images)

Tyrell Shavers dominates Buffalo Bills offensive snaps against Tampa Bay Buccaneers

The Buffalo Bills’ wide receiver lineup is in disarray, and the key question is who will rise to the occasion. With Dalton Kincaid out for Week 12 due to a knee issue and Curtis Samuel out with a hamstring injury, Buffalo has turned to a blend of veterans, rookies, and practice squad call-ups. Keon Coleman, the 2024 second-round draft pick from Florida State, had a standout Week 1 with 112 yards, but he’s been lackluster since, averaging just 27.3 yards per game and catching only 57.5 percent of his targets. On top of that, Coleman’s professionalism has slipped, as he arrived late to a team meeting last Friday and was a healthy scratch for the second consecutive week against the Houston Texans.This created an opportunity for Tyrell Shavers, a 26-year-old wide receiver who went undrafted and spent two seasons quietly on the Bills’ practice squad. Article Title: Tom Brady's ex-wife Gisele Bündchen reflected on the turbulent years when depression and panic attacks took over her life
Article Text:

A naturopathic doctor's advice to address her lifestyle, including diet and sleep, initiated a profound transformation, leading her to prioritize well-being and share her journey through her cookbook.

How Gisele Bündchen rebuilt her mind and body after hitting her lowest point

In one of her most candid conversations, Gisele Bündchen looked back on a period that many fans never knew she struggled through. Long before she became one of the world’s most recognizable supermodels, Bündchen’s early 20s were marked by overwhelming panic attacks, exhaustion, and what she now recognizes as “severe” depression.In 2024, speaking on The View, she described those years as “one of the worst times in my life,” a stark contrast to the glamorous image the world saw. In retrospect, she realizes the chaos of constant travel, poor sleep, processed food, and relentless pressure created the perfect storm. But what ultimately changed everything and led her toward a healthier life, was finally understanding the connection between her lifestyle and her mental health.During her modeling rise, Bündchen was thrust into independence early, traveling from Brazil to Japan and then to New York while still a teenager. She recalled feeling grateful at the time, but her nonstop schedule gradually became destructive. “I wasn’t really paying attention, I was just going, like a hundred miles an hour,” she told the hosts. She admitted she had “no idea that it was correlated with my lifestyle and food was a big part of it.That realization came only after she sought help and spoke with a naturopathic doctor. When she openly described her daily routine, “I drink, I smoke, I have coffee”, the specialist immediately pointed out the core issue. “He said, ‘Listen… stop right there.’ He says, ‘You’re not sleeping. You’re in different time zones all the time. You’re eating, like, terrible all day.’”What followed was a complete reset. With guidance, she began eating intentionally, getting consistent sleep, and exercising daily. Within about 18 months, she said, “everything changed.” Meditation, yoga, and breath work soon became part of her routine, helping her rebuild her mental and emotional foundation.Two decades later, Bündchen is sharing those lessons through her cookbook Nourish, hoping others won’t wait as long as she did to prioritize their well-being. “Let the food be your medicine,” she said, a simple philosophy born from one of the hardest chapters of her life.Also Read: Why Gisele Bündchen reportedly grew tired of Tom Brady resurfaces in old divorce insights
